issues.title: Reservation & Execution API (FastAPI) Implementation
issues.body:
Implement REST endpoints for reservations and executions using FastAPI.

**Endpoints**:
- `POST /reservations` — create reservation
- `GET /reservations/{id}` — fetch reservation
- `POST /executions` — create execution request
- `GET /executions/{id}` — fetch execution

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Endpoints implemented and validated with Pydantic schemas.
- Every API response includes `correlation_id` header/field.
- OpenAPI schema available at `/docs`.
- Unit tests for each endpoint (happy & validation paths).

**Notes**: keep controllers thin; business logic in service layer.

issues.title: Define Execution and Queue Task Data Models
issues.body:
Create python data models for Execution, Task, TaskStatus and related types.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Data classes (dataclasses or pydantic) exist under `api/models`.
- Task types enumerated: `provision`, `run`, `collect`, `teardown`.
- Serialization/deserialization unit tests present.
- Models imported consistently across API, scheduler, worker.

issues.title: Lightweight Scheduler (Policy Engine)
issues.body:
Implement a scheduler that evaluates reservations and creates tasks based on a simple FIFO policy that is extensible for priorities and tags.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Scheduler accepts pending executions and selects an available bench (mock).
- Enqueues tasks into queue abstraction for provision/run/collect/teardown.
- Unit tests validate FIFO behavior and task creation.
- Scheduler code is modular and documented for later policy extensions.

issues.title: Mock Queue Abstraction (In-Memory)
issues.body:
Provide an in-memory queue abstraction that supports at-least-once semantics and retry metadata for Sprint 2 use.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Queue provides `push`, `pop`, `ack`, and `requeue` operations.
- Retry metadata (attempts, next_attempt_ts) tracked per task.
- Used by scheduler and worker in all local flows.
- Unit tests for delivery and retry behavior.

issues.title: Runner Adapter Interface (Strategy Pattern)
issues.body:
Design and implement the abstract runner adapter interface used by workers to provision, run tests, collect artifacts, and teardown.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Interface methods: `provision(bench_spec)`, `run_test(handle, payload)`, `collect_artifacts(handle)`, `teardown(handle)`.
- Base class documented with expected return types and error behavior.
- Unit tests assert contract compliance (mock implementations can be validated against tests).

issues.title: Mock Runner Implementation (Local/SIL Simulation)
issues.body:
Create a mock runner that simulates bench provisioning and test execution for local development and CI.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Mock simulates deterministic execution (configurable pass/fail), produces fake logs/artifacts.
- Implements runner adapter interface.
- Used in worker integration tests and end-to-end flows.
- Documentation on how to configure deterministic outcomes.

issues.title: Worker Lifecycle: Task Consumer & Executor
issues.body:
Implement the worker process that consumes tasks from the queue and drives adapter calls for provision/run/collect/teardown.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Worker consumes tasks and updates execution state in persistence.
- Implements retry/backoff using task metadata and routes to DLQ on repeated failures.
- Logs include correlation_id and task context.
- Integration tests covering success and retry scenarios with mock runner.

issues.title: Structured Logging & Error Handling Primitives
issues.body:
Establish a unified structured logging format and error-handling utilities for API and workers.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- JSON log schema with `timestamp`, `level`, `component`, `correlation_id`, `message`, `context`.
- Error utilities map exceptions to HTTP responses with consistent error codes.
- Logs emitted in API and worker flows; unit tests validate log output structure.

issues.title: Basic Persistence Layer (In-Memory / SQLite)
issues.body:
Implement a minimal persistence layer to store benches, reservations, and executions suitable for local dev and CI.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- CRUD operations for reservations and executions implemented.
- Persistence interface abstracted for later swap to Postgres/DynamoDB.
- Basic optimistic concurrency placeholder implemented.
- Unit tests cover store operations.

issues.title: Initial CLI (Typer) with reserve/run/status
issues.body:
Create a developer CLI using Typer with basic commands to interact with the API.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Commands implemented: `reserve`, `run`, `status`.
- CLI authenticates using a local token cache and respects exit codes.
- CLI implemented in `cli/` and referenced in README.
- Integration tests validate CLI -> API interactions against local dev server.

issues.title: Unit Test Suite & Coverage Setup
issues.body:
Create pytest-based tests for API, scheduler, worker, and adapters; enforce minimum coverage for Sprint 2 scope.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Tests for happy and error paths exist for core modules.
- Coverage threshold ≥ 60% for Sprint 2 changed files.
- CI fails when tests or coverage rules fail.

issues.title: Integrate Bandit, ruff, and mypy into CI
issues.body:
Add security and quality gates to GitHub Actions: Bandit for security, ruff for linting, mypy for type checking.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Bandit scan executes; high severity findings fail CI.
- ruff linting step included; style violations fail CI.
- mypy run enabled in strict-ish mode for new code; type failures fail CI.

issues.title: GitHub Actions CI Pipeline for Sprint 2
issues.body:
Create a GitHub Actions workflow that runs lint, type-check, tests, and security scans on PRs and pushes to main.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Workflow triggers on PRs and pushes to `main`.
- Steps: setup -> ruff -> mypy -> pytest -> bandit.
- Caching of dependencies implemented to speed up runs.
- Status badge added to README.

issues.title: ADR: Queue Abstraction (Local -> Remote Migration Path)
issues.body:
Create an ADR documenting why a local queue abstraction is used in Sprint 2 and the migration plan to a remote queue (SQS/RabbitMQ) in Sprint 3.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- ADR created in `docs/ADRs/ADR-queue-abstraction.md`.
- Contains rationale, trade-offs, migration steps, and acceptance criteria for the remote queue.
- Reviewed and approved by the team.

issues.title: API Contracts & Component Boundary Documentation
issues.body:
Document API contracts, component responsibilities, and runner adapter specification in `docs/`.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- `docs/API_CONTRACTS.md` with request/response examples for reservation and execution endpoints.
- `docs/COMPONENTS.md` describing scheduler, worker, adapters, and persistence boundaries.
- Adapter spec includes method signatures and expected behaviors.

issues.title: Integration Test: End-to-End Mock Execution (reserve → run → collect)
issues.body:
Create an automated integration test that runs the full flow using only local mocks: reserve a bench, scheduler enqueues tasks, worker runs mock runner, artifacts collected.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- End-to-end test in `tests/integration/` that validates state transitions and artifact URI availability.
- Test runs in CI and passes deterministically.
- Logs assert correlation_id propagation across components.
